title: Copy tarball files in local mirror in stage
body:
I tried to install the newest gcc compiler 'gcc@9.2.0'. With the restricted web access, there is one dependency library wasn't installed successfully which failed with fetching from the mirrors in the internet. 
I put downloaded tar.gz file in my local mirror folder as mentioned in https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/mirrors.html.
Then I installed the mission package again, I found Spack still use Curl to fetch from the file location which has tarball file as following log:

==> Installing pkgconf
==> Searching for binary cache of pkgconf
==> Finding buildcaches in /spack/location/mirrors//build_cache
==> No binary for pkgconf found: installing from source
==> Fetching file:///mirrors/location/pkgconf/pkgconf-1.6.3.tar.xz
**curl: (37) Couldn't open file /mirrors/location/pkgconf/pkgconf-1.6.3.tar.xz
==> Fetching from file:///mirrors/location/pkgconf/pkgconf-1.6.3.tar.xz failed.**

Is there a way asking spack just copy the file instead using Curl to fetch a file?
Thanks in advance!
